unnormalised: So, last month, my boss, Mr. Sharma, asked me to prepone our team meeting. He sent out an email on 12/07/2024 saying, "Let's meet on 19/07/2024 at 11:00 AM instead of 26/07/2024." My initial reaction? Ugh. That meant shuffling my entire schedule. I already had a dentist appointment booked for the 26th.
normalised: So, last month, my boss, Mister Sharma, asked me to prepone our team meeting. He sent out an email on twelfth july two thousand and twenty four saying, "Let's meet on nineteenth july two thousand and twenty four at eleven A-M instead of twenty sixth july two thousand and twenty four." My initial reaction? Ugh. That meant shuffling my entire schedule. I already had a dentist appointment booked for the twenty sixth.

unnormalised: I usually start my day around 8:30 AM, after dropping my daughter, Diya, at school. The original meeting time was perfect, as it slotted right in between my morning tasks and lunch. But 11:00 AM on the 19th? That cut right into the project deadline I was trying to meet.
normalised: I usually start my day around eight thirty A-M, after dropping my daughter, Diya, at school. The original meeting time was perfect, as it slotted right in between my morning tasks and lunch. But eleven A-M on the nineteenth? That cut right into the project deadline I was trying to meet.

unnormalised: The meeting was supposed to be a brainstorming session for our new campaign launch. It was initially scheduled for 2 hours. And honestly, those 2 hours felt crucial. My colleague, Riya, even joked, "Another meeting? Does Mr. Sharma know we have actual work to do?" She's usually quite sarcastic, that one.
normalised: The meeting was supposed to be a brainstorming session for our new campaign launch. It was initially scheduled for two hours. And honestly, those two hours felt crucial. My colleague, Riya, even joked, "Another meeting? Does Mister Sharma know we have actual work to do?" She's usually quite sarcastic, that one.

unnormalised: Trying to accommodate the new time, I had to email Dr. Patel's clinic to reschedule my appointment. They only had slots available on 02/08/2024, which was a bit of a bummer. I also had to shift my lunch plans with my friend, Aisha, who was visiting from Kolkata. We were supposed to catch up at 1:00 PM that day.
normalised: Trying to accommodate the new time, I had to email Doctor Patel's clinic to reschedule my appointment. They only had slots available on second august two thousand and twenty four, which was a bit of a bummer. I also had to shift my lunch plans with my friend, Aisha, who was visiting from Kolkata. We were supposed to catch up at one P-M that day.

unnormalised: Anyway, the 19th came, and the meeting started promptly at 11:00 AM. It lasted exactly 1 hour and 45 mins. To my surprise, it was actually productive! We finalized the campaign strategy and even managed to pre-plan most of the actionables.
normalised: Anyway, the nineteenth came, and the meeting started promptly at eleven A-M. It lasted exactly one hour and forty five minutes. To my surprise, it was actually productive! We finalized the campaign strategy and even managed to pre-plan most of the actionables.

unnormalised: Looking back, while the initial change felt disruptive, the preponed meeting actually saved us time in the long run. We were able to launch the campaign a week ahead of schedule. Maybe Mr. Sharma was onto something after all. He's always talking about optimizing for the 'golden hour', whatever that is. Maybe I need to start prepone-ing my personal deadlines too!
normalised: Looking back, while the initial change felt disruptive, the preponed meeting actually saved us time in the long run. We were able to launch the campaign a week ahead of schedule. Maybe Mister Sharma was onto something after all. He's always talking about optimizing for the 'golden hour', whatever that is. Maybe I need to start prepone-ing my personal deadlines too!
